alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 2:39AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Shawnee and west central Douglas Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 239 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Berryton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Topeka, Richland and Berryton. This includes Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 184 and 190. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
